metadata.name: Nothing Is Forever
metadata.description:
Year 2022
Edition 1/1

The Vernonia creepers - widely known to SE Asia's horticulturalists by the moniker 'Lee Kuan Yew Creeper' - have been pruned by Nila Choo to spell the letters LKY. 

The Vernonia creepers was first introduced into Singapore when “The Garden City“ was conceptualized and spearheaded by the founding Prime Minister. It is rumoured that the robust plant was nicknamed LKY creeper because it is hardy and reaches everywhere. The passing of Lee Kuan Yew in 2015 begets the question of what makes an adequate monument for him. 

Nila Choo not only poses the question of nature versus nurture as in a nation's development, but also as a  momento mori. Power, like everything else, does not last forever.  Without constant pruning and cutting, the memory of a much feared public figure in Singapore grows back into illegibility. 



The NFT owner has the right to physically install and exhibit the artwork in variable dimensions with Vernonia creepers maintaining the letters LKY.
